title.narrative: CHILD FRIENDLY SCHOOLS

description.narrative: Models for operationalizing national child friendly schools and system developed and tested in disadvantaged counties and used to inform implementation at national level., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children in China aged 6 to 18 years, particularly the most vulnerable, have improved equitable access to and complete child-friendly learning and â€œsuzhi jiaoyuâ€ oriented education.

System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Models for operationalizing national child friendly schools and system developed and tested in disadvantaged counties andused to inform implementation at national level.

description.narrative: The CFS model was developed and promoted through further assessment and sharing of the CFS Impact Study findings, high-level dialogue, and advocacy. UNICEF continued to strengthen its work with MOE on improving quality of education data with the national sampling survey system. Hundreds of millions of children, teachers and parents have benefited from UNICEF’s COVID-19 response programmes jointly initiated with MOE. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2021
